page.title: 16Crafts in Tongue
page.content: A building which was once the old school has become a large shop which specialises in woollen and tweed goods and locally made craft articles. The owner also weaves a lot of his own mterial using a foot operated loom. Local ladies knit Aran or Lopi sweaters for sale in the shop and many touring buses stop to look for authent ic Scottish woollen products, and are not disappointed. A smaller shop in the village deals with smaller items of craft work and more especially pottery, glass and jewellery. Both shops have some fairly expensive items of quality for sale, but there are also many smaller items which visitors can buy to take home as souvenirs.
